#Text=Patrick Hepburn , 1st Earl of Bothwell
#Text=Patrick Hepburn , 1st Earl of Bothwell ( died 18 October 1508 ) was Lord High Admiral of Scotland .
#Text=He rose to political prominence after supporting James IV against his father , and was proxy at the King 's marriage .
#Text=Career
#Text=Patrick was the son of Adam Hepburn , Master of Hailes , and succeeded his grandfather also Patrick Hepburn as the 2nd Lord Hailes in ( 1482/1483 ) .

#Text=He or his grandfather held Berwick Castle against an English army led by Richard , Duke of Gloucester until the last week of August 1482 , after which Berwick upon Tweed became a possession of England .
#Text=Under his territorial designation of " Patrick Hepburn of Dunsyre , " he was made Sheriff of Berwickshire on 15 June 1480 .

column1: #Text=Patrick Hepburn , Lord Hailes , was one of the Conservators of a truce with England on 20 September 1484 .

#Text=He was one of the leaders of the Confederate Lords who rebelled against King James III of Scotland , and he led the vanguard against the Royal array at the battle of Sauchieburn , 11 July 1488 .
#Text=Robert Birrel , a 16th-century writer , believed that he was one of those responsible for the murder of the king after the battle .

#Text=In the reign of James IV he rose to great power and held many offices including : Master of the King 's Household , custodian of Edinburgh Castle , and Sheriff Principal of Edinburgh and Haddington .
#Text=His son and heir Adam Hepburn , 2nd Earl of Bothwell was made Master of the Royal Stables .
#Text=Patrick Hepburn was appointed Lord High Admiral of Scotland on 10 September 1488 .
#Text=In September 1491 , Bothwell went on a diplomatic mission to France to renew the Auld Alliance .
#Text=He left from North Berwick aboard the Katherine .
#Text=His fellow ambassadors were Robert Blackadder , Archbishop of Glasgow and the Dean of Glasgow . [ 1 ]
#Text=On 13 October 1488 , he had a Crown charter of the feudal lordships of Chrichton and Bothwell , which were in the King 's hands following the forfeiture of John Ramsay , Lord Bothwell .
#Text=On 17 October the lordship of Bothwell was erected into an Earldom in his favour , and he was created the 1st Earl of Bothwell .

#Text=On 6 March 1492 , he had a charter of the lands and lordship of Liddesdale , with Hermitage Castle , and more , upon the resignation of the same by Archibald Douglas , 5th Earl of Angus , the latter getting the lordship of Bothwell [ but not the Earldom ] which Patrick in turn resigned .
#Text=Patrick was appointed Captain of Dumbarton Castle on 1 April 1495 .

#Text=He was one of the diplomats sent to conclude the treaty for the marriage of James IV with Princess Margaret Tudor of England in October 1501 , and he stood proxy for the King at the ceremony of betrothal on 25 January 1502 .
#Text=Family
#Text=He married twice :
#Text=Janet or Joanna Douglas , before February 1481 , ( d. before 21 February 1491 ) , daughter of James Douglas , 1st Earl of Morton by his spouse , Princess Joanna Stewart .
#Text=They had one daughter :
#Text=Joanna Hepburn , ( d. 1558 ) , married to George Seton , 5th Lord Seton , who fell at Flodden .
#Text=Margaret Gordon , by contract dated 21 February 1491 , daughter of George Gordon , 2nd Earl of Huntly .
#Text=They had four sons and a daughter :
#Text=Adam Hepburn , 2nd Earl of Bothwell , who succeeded him .
#Text=Patrick Hepburn of Bolton
#Text=William Hepburn of Rollandston
#Text=John Hepburn , Bishop of Brechin
#Text=Margaret Hepburn , married Archibald Douglas , 6th Earl of Angus
